artefact: Compensation if you're the victim of a terrorist attack

artefact.alternative_title: Find out if you can claim for compensation as a victim of terrorism and how to claim.
artefact.overview: If you've been a victim of terrorism abroad, you may be able to claim compensation
artefact.body:
You may be able to claim compensation if you’ve been a victim of terrorism abroad.

You can claim if you:

  • were injured in a specific act of terrorism - a ‘designated act’
  • have a disability that was caused by your injuries
  • are a British, EU, EEA or Swiss citizen
  • lived in the UK for 3 years before the act of terrorism happened

You won’t be able to claim if you have recovered from your injuries, or if you were bereaved.

Designated acts

Only those still suffering injuries from the following incidents can make a claim:

  • bombings in Bali, Indonesia (12 October 2002)
  • bombings in Kusadasi, Turkey (16 July 2005)
  • attacks against tourist sites in Sharm El Sheikh, Egypt (23 July 2005)
  • bombings in Dahab, Egypt (24 April 2006)
  • bombings in Marmaris, Turkey (27 August 2006)
  • attacks in Mumbai, India (26 November 2008)

How to claim

To claim, fill in and return the application form.

Download ‘Victims of overseas terrorism - application form’ (PDF, 224KB)
